pageContext.description: 2 vertical grooves below stop-ridge (vestigal trident ornament). Blow-hole at base of diaphragm on one side.
pageContext.patina: Slight turquoise-green patina above: rough blue-green oxide below.
pageContext.other: Width: edge 64mm; centre 29mm; butt 27mm,Thickness: centre 8mm; 34mm,Weight:614.39 gms
pageContext.associations: Found with 8 other palstaves, 1 socketed celt (7 unlooped, 2 looped palstaves, 1 edge only)
pageContext.publications: E.T. Leeds, Proc. Soc. Antiq. xxviii (1916), pp. 147-152, fig 2.,E.T. Leeds, Arch. Survey Oxon, Archaeologia, lxxi, 251 (+ refs)
pageContext.site: England, oxfordshire,cowley,cowley road,leopold street,found during drainage works on site of tram stables,formerly cowley marsh, 1881-2
